title: VideoLectures.net - The story that was recognized at InCo 2007

author: Davor Orlič, Knowledge 4 All Foundation Ltd.

segmentation: Next one we would like to present, as I mentioned at the beginning, a story that just grew so tremendously that it's sometimes really hard to believe we met them for the first time about two years ago at one of our conferences in conferences 2008 and now they are the world leaders in a special type of tools.
What kind of tools we will be told by the representative of federal lectures from the Institute user Steven?

Everybody, you're all fans, right, thanks.

We have 12,000 videos.
Which is quite a lot 8000 unique visitors per day, which means 8000 people watch lectures every day.
I think the the Faculty of Economics has 8000 students, so we do lectures.
We have like 8000 students.
Like a faculty birthday.

Almost 1000 authors.

I think there are five pages in the world like like ours and I think four of them are in the United States.
And the only European one is ours so.
Just to give you some small.
Info about that so.
Video lectures is becoming more like a movement, so we decided to.
To start off a international foundation which is called knowledge for all.
And just a few brief points about knowledge for.
Actually, the first one knowledge and content exchange network, which means.
Um?
We are taking all of our partners and the institutions and friend organizations.
That provide content to us into something bigger.
Trying to do a free and open open scientific content platform around videolectures.net.
This thing would also be distributed networks and bottom up governed.
We're looking for funds.
And we are also looking for within knowledge for.
Um?
Joint projects, as in institutions that would provide content to videolectures.net.
And of course we would use the existing University networks and resources to broaden up and have even more content.
Um?
One thing that would be a that's not there as far as video is concerned.
The distinctive element will be that all content would be scientifically approved.
So in plain language there wouldn't be.
There would be no crap on videolectures.net, so only good stuff.

Speaking as as a.
International Foundation we are also moving, so this would be on the macro level and we're also moving one step below which is the.
Micro level like in Slovenia and we're starting off with a news Ovid, which is called Savage.
9 years of cell.
In English, knowledge for all Institute.
Which would be a nonprofit organization based here in Indiana.
We would work on development and dissemination of high quality scientific and educational content, which means that we would work.
On content which is already presented on videolectures.net but in a more broad sense, of course everything would be free of charge and unlimited services will be provided to all parties.
Specially to those who have limitations in the field in the field of education, so probably many.
Many of you here would would probably be interested in cooperating with us on that level.
Video is not just video, but it means that it has a didactic value.
So we could envision an inchoate curriculum for the future, if you know what I mean.
Coming up from the video perspective.
And of course, our our wishes to cooperate with Slovenian words.
Leading academic and educational institutions, as well as companies.
While my saying companies.
Becausw, I think in this.
Economic moment of turmoil.
Adding companies could contribute within this open and free educational scheme that we are trying to push forward.
Um?
And if you if you need us, you can contact us at.
That email, thanks.
